title: In Pursuit of Justice
content:
We are inclined to believe that America has turned the corner on inequity and injustice. To some extent it’s true. <!--more--> But the most powerful argument that there’s still a long way to go exists, ironically, in its courts, where the festering sore that is America’s racial divide is seen in all its putrid glory.
Attorney Benjamin Crump gives an insider’s view of the legal warfare he and lawyers like him wage every day in the courts for justice, citing some of his most recent cases, including Trayvon Martin (Florida), Ernest Hoskins (Arkansas) and Howard Morgan (Chicago).
